DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::24 Hour Creatinine Clearance Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Milliliter per Minute Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place milliliter per minute numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of 24 hour creatinine clearance in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::24 Hour Creatinine Clearance Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::24_A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._The determination of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::24:In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:Measurement of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
The determination of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Milliliter per Minute Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A metric unit of volumetric flow rate defined as the rate at which one milliliter of matter crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one minute._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Milliliter per Minute Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A metric unit of volumetric flow rate defined as the rate at which one milliliter of matter crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one minute.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A metric unit of volumetric flow rate defined as the rate at which one milliliter of matter crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one minute.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
